   Jemalloc with Reallocate shows an improvement on a single thread. What happens when there are multiple concurrent allocations? 
   
   (my understanding is that jemalloc tends to maintain separate heaps, partly to facilitate concurrrency. So concurrent allocations would not interfere?)
   
   Are there hints one can drop to jemalloc that one intends to grow the block to increase the chance of growing the allocation in-place? i.e. have the allocator choose to place concurrent allocations in separate heaps?

fields.description:
This should allow us to do aligned realloc calls.

As we don't want to enforce jemalloc as the only allocator, this will be an additional (small) leaf library.
